body_html:
padding, dilation and ceil_mode were only printed if they were non-default (because they are rarer). This helps to keep the verbosity down in printing.
Is there a reason you changed that to just printing these fields always? If not, can you revert to the old behavior on those?
body_text:
padding, dilation and ceil_mode were only printed if they were non-default (because they are rarer). This helps to keep the verbosity down in printing.
Is there a reason you changed that to just printing these fields always? If not, can you revert to the old behavior on those?
body:
padding, dilation and ceil_mode were only printed if they were non-default (because they are rarer). This helps to keep the verbosity down in printing.
Is there a reason you changed that to just printing these fields always? If not, can you revert to the old behavior on those?
